translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .🔽The Group of Sixes
I was afflicted by grief for my son,
my mind was disturbed, I was confused;
I was naked, with my hair disheveled,
In the streets, in the charnel ground,
in the wilderness, and on the roads,
Then I saw the Fortunate One,
The one who tames the untamed,
the Buddha, fearless in every way.
I bowed down and sat down;
Applying myself to the Teacher’s word,
All my grief is cut off,
The bases are fully understood by me,
